title: Information System Template
description: Defines how information travels in a sovereign power -- news methods, message speed, censorship, and notable information networks. Information flow determines how fast news travels and therefore how characters can plan.

method.description: Posted notices, town criers, messengers, pigeons, magic, radio, internet-equivalent

message_speed.description: How fast can a message travel across the power?

literacy_impact.description: How literacy rate affects information access

messenger_protections.description: Whether messengers have legal protections -- distinctive clothing (sash), right to accommodations, penalties for interference

mail_system.description: Whether a formal mail system exists -- ships, stagecoaches, riders carrying mail for ordinary people, guarded convoys for royal mail

hacking_interference.description: Risks of message interception or corruption

magic_based_communication.description: If magic exists, how it affects communication

notable_information_networks.description: Notable spy networks, news organizations, or communication systems

how_characters_access_news.description: How typical characters learn about events

x-cross-references.sovereign-power-profile: This system belongs to a sovereign power
x-cross-references.magic-system-overview: Magical communication methods depend on the magic system
